paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted KCNH2 variants associated with Long QT Syndrome type 2, focusing on protein solubility and trafficking data.

functional_data.summary: Variant introduces larger side-chains at conserved and buried residues, likely causing PASD destabilization through conformational strain.

variants.additional_notes: Solubility tends to decrease as hydrophobic side-chain volume increases.
key_quotes: Destabilization can result from loss of non-covalent interactions. For example, the LQT2-linked variants V41F and C64Y/W introduce larger side-chains at conserved and buried residues and likely cause PASD destabilization through conformational strain.

tables_processed.table_caption: Conservation and solvent accessibility of LQT2 residues

challenges: No individual-level penetrance data was provided in the text.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper focused on functional assays and solubility as a proxy for pathogenicity, without detailed patient-level data.
